title:
The linear Shafarevich conjecture for quasiprojective varieties and
  algebraicity of Shafarevich morphisms
authors: Benjamin Bakker, Yohan Brunebarbe and Jacob Tsimerman
abstract:
We prove that the universal cover of a normal complex algebraic variety
admitting a faithful complex representation of its fundamental group is an
analytic Zariski open subset of a holomorphically convex complex space. This is
a non-proper version of the Shafarevich conjecture. More generally we define a
class of subset of the Betti stack for which the covering space trivializing
the corresponding local systems has this property. Secondly, we show that for
any complex local system $V$ on a normal complex algebraic variety $X$ there is
an algebraic map $f \colon X\to Y$ contracting precisely the subvarieties on
which $V$ is isotrivial.
